name: The Longest Day
description: The temporal crisis has resurrected the planet Xindus—locked eternally in its explosive final day! Several Starfleet personnel are caught up in that looping tragedy. Determine the fate of Xindus, the loop, and the Starfleet personnel trapped within!
rules:
— In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Faction Missions in one phase, and Supply Missions in another phase.
— There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
— Unique Faction Missions and Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
— Using any version of Jake Sisko, Archer, or Kim will provide a bonus to Faction Missions and Supply Missions.
— Every Faction or Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
— Community Rewards are also available during Phase 2 only. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
— In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Jake Sisko, Archer, or Kim
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.flavor: Fifteen years after losing Voyager in an attempt to get home, Harry resolved to alter the past to save the ship.

adventures.name: Dress Rehearsal
adventures.description: Simulate potential outcomes utilizing the Holodeck.

adventures.name: Looking Back
adventures.description: Review historical documents about the conflict on Xindus.

adventures.name: Closing the Circle
adventures.description: Restrict access to the Delphic Expanse.

adventures.name: For Observation
adventures.description: Track the quantity of chronitons surrounding Xindus.

rewards.name: The Longest Day
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

goals.flavor: Do as Archer and Sisko request—maintain the timeline.

rewards.name: Kim
rewards.flavor: Fifteen years after losing Voyager in an attempt to get home, Harry resolved to alter the past to save the ship.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

next_threshold_rewards.name: Chronitons
next_threshold_rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

screens.text: "Captain, the temporal crisis has brought back the planet Xindus. But it is not the planet on any normal day. No, this version of Xindus is reliving its last brutal day, where the seismic fissures were bombed, ripping Xindus to shreds."

"Reliving your most destructive mistakes over and over...I've been there mentally and it's hell. But to actually physically replay it over and over, I can't even imagine. And as if that weren't bad enough..."

"We have Starfleet personnel trapped on the surface, being forced to live out this experience over and over. The Dominion and Hirogen have both taken a strong interest in Xindus' fate, and neither side will back down."

"The Dominion want Xindus' original fate to remain, where the Hirogen think that the surface of Xindus and the continued existence of the Avians might be more exciting for future hunts. I just want to rescue our personnel, close the loop, and get out of here."

"Captain, this is Jake Sisko. Captain Archer and I are here on the surface of Xindus. We've been listening to your communications with Mr. Kim and, well, as crazy as it might sound, we think you should leave Xindus and the temporal loop as is."

"Living out this day on repeat is hell, that's for sure. But that's the point. It always resets. Though the world is destroyed at day's end, we're back to square one the next morning. And maybe that's how it should be left, don't you think?"

responses.text: "Leaving the loop intact still ensures that Xindus meets its fate by day's end..."
"It is possible to hunt on the surface of Xindus for most of the final day."

screens.text: "You're right. I guess the Dominion believe the best outcome still involves the extinction of the Avians, since it means the other Xindi races survive, but I still have a hard time accepting that as the right choice."

"If the Hirogen are so desperate for a hunt, than I suppose you are right. They would get their wish. But, Captain, I'm down here. I can't see how anyone would put themselves in the middle of this intentionally."

"Who cares what the Dominion OR the Hirogen want? This whole thing seems crazy... but on the other hand, to decide a planet's fate like that when it has another shot... maybe leaving the loop intact and thus making no decision either way would is our best option."
